intro: Anuragia crassicaulis, commonly known as the broad-stemmed anuragia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern India. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats at elevations ranging from 1,500 to 3,000 meters. Its leaves are broad and somewhat fleshy, adapted to conserve water in its arid environment. The flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, making it a distinctive and ornamental species.
